content: Sen. Kent Conrad, D-N.D.,addressed Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner, who was testifying in defense of the administration's budget policies. The chairman of the Senate Budget Committee is voicing concerns about President Obama's increased spending on health care, calling it an already "bloated system." Sen. Kent Conrad, D-N.D., also said he worries that Obama's policies proposals do little to lower deficits in the second half of the budget's 10-year projections. Conrad on Thursday addressed Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner, who was testifying in defense of the administration's budget policies. The Obama budget would increase spending on health care by more than $600 billion over 10 years. "http://www.foxnews.com/politics/first100days/2009/03/12/key-democrat-worries-obamas-health-care-spending-plan/100days/" "A government big enough to give you everything you want, is strong enough to take everything you have." ~ Gerald Ford

title: Key Democrat Worries About Obama's Health Care Spending Plan
